::GoldenEye::

She looked at Dollen.  She wasn't sure what to think.  Here was a bot 
that she cared for deeply, in utter torment.  And what hurt her more, 
was the fact that there was nothing she could do.  She could only 
watch as he suffered with the pictures of some bot in his head. She 
flew downa nd transformed into bot mode and put her hand on his 
shoulder. "I don't know why or how this bot is in your head or why 
you see the images, but I shall help you. I shall be here for you." 
She walked with him and fought off the tears welling up in her eyes.  
It hurt her knowing that she wouldnt be any help to him. Destiny was 
something that one delt with by themselves. 


--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "dcoburn" <dcoburn@n...> wrote:
> ::Dollen::
> 
>           Dollen stopped, and fell down on his knees, and put his 
head in
> his hands.
> 
>            "I....Don't........Know.....What's..Wrong!!!  I..I can't 
explain
> it!!  These visions!!!!  Who is she????  WHO IS SHE?????" Then, 
suddenly,
> images went through Dollen's head.  Images.
> 
>           Now, Dollen was inside his own mind.
> 
>          The Silver Fox.
> 
>         "The Silver Fox," He said, strangely.
> 
>         "I have to find the silver fox.........I must find 
her.......It's my
> destiny......." Then, Dollen had more images.
> 
>           A spider............A wolf...............A 
tyrant..........A
> fool.........A bond.....A destiny..........Faith and Trust.....
> 
>           Then, Dollen said with a firm look on his face, "We have 
to go
> join KitKat and the others."
